text: A flapper was a trendy young woman in the 1920s. Flapper may also refer to: * Flapper (company), a Brazilian transportation network company for aviation * The Flapper, a 1920 American film directed by Alan Crosland * Flapper valve, a part of some flush toilet mechanisms * Flappers (TV series), a Canadian sitcom produced by the CBC in the late 1970s * Flapper, a rock-climbing-related avulsion injury * Flapper!, a play by Tim Kelly and Bill Francoeur * QP:flapper, a two-member illustrator unit consisting of Japanese artists Tometa Ohara and Koharu Sakura
title: Flapper (disambiguation)
